instruction: What were the results of comparing the performance of the three machine-learning models in estimating soil-texture fractions using coefficient of determination (R-2), root mean square error (RMSE), and mean absolute error (MAE) values?
Output:
The results of comparing the performance of the three machine-learning models in estimating soil-texture fractions using coefficient of determination (R-2), root mean square error (RMSE), and mean absolute error (MAE) values are as follows:

- The XGBoost model had the highest R-2 values for all soil-texture fractions, with values of 90% for clay, 85% for silt, and 91% for sand.
- The RF model had lower R-2 values compared to XGBoost, with values of 86% for clay, 66% for silt, and 86% for sand.
- The SVR model had the lowest R-2 values among the three models, with values of 72% for clay, 56% for silt, and 86% for sand.

Based on these results, the XGBoost model performed the best in estimating soil-texture fractions, followed by the RF model, and then the SVR model.
